description:
Highlights from the Putney Society's Modern Architecture Gazetteer in a self-guided walk around Putney Heath.
Start Portsmouth Road and finish Green Man PH.

factsheet.heading: Putney Society Modern Buildings Walk – Putney Heath
paragraphs: A selection of interesting modern buildings: do look and admire from outside but please note the houses and most estates are private.

factsheet.heading: Bowling Green Close, Portsmouth Road
paragraphs: This enclave contains a remarkable mix of 1930s styles. Pitt Cottage, 1936, is in Arts and Crafts vernacular revival cottagey style, while flat roofed, squared off Chatham House 1933 in brown brick with green paintwork (the original colour) represents the Art Deco/Modern Movement. Bowling Green House with its green pantiles is in a more Spanish style.

These are eclipsed by the dramatic cream rendering and black paintwork of the glorious curving corners and balconies of Hollwood/Moonside 1935, Pitts Walk 1935, and the spectacular Ridings 1935, all attributed to the famous firm of Wallis Gilbert and Partners, which was responsible for major Art Deco buildings including the Hoover and Firestone factories.

factsheet.heading: Highlands Heath, Portsmouth Road, 1936
paragraphs: Of the same decade, yet vastly different, this planned estate illustrates the demand for mansion flats. Originally fronting the main road to Portsmouth, the 10 Tudor-esque blocks stand around central tennis courts reflecting the 1930s fixation with health but with, nevertheless, underground garaging for the car-owning residents. Aimed at an upmarket clientele, the show flats were furnished by Liberty’s.
**Turn right and right again for Wildcroft Manor**

factsheet.heading: Wildcroft Manor, Wildcroft Road, 1930s
paragraphs: A much more pretentious estate set in formal landscaped gardens. Its magnificent entrance gates (listed) date from 1900.
**Back and follow Telegraph Road to bring you out opposite the Ashburton Estate**

factsheet.heading: Ashburton Estate, Putney Heath/Carslake Road, 1952
paragraphs: The 62 acre estate was built on the site of five major mansions to help ease the post war housing crisis. It originally provided 1233 flats and houses, laundries, storage, 41 garages, 21 shops, a health centre, pubs and a library, altogether an excellent example of well-planned, well-designed public housing.

factsheet.heading: Exeter House, Putney Heath c1935
paragraphs: Replaced the first of the great mansions along Putney Heath to be demolished. 3 blocks of 4 storeys with a petite central polygonal lodge at the entrance. Laurie Lee, describing his Putney days in 'As I Walked out One Midsummer Morning', may have worked as a labourer on the site.

factsheet.heading: See more Modern Architecture in Putney and Roehampton
paragraphs: A pdf of the Putney Society's Gazetteer of Modern Architecture in Putney and Roehampton (2019) can be downloaded from  https://www.putneysociety.org.uk/index.php?q=news-and-issues/a-gazetteer-of-modern-architecture-in-putney-and-roehampton.html

images.title: One of a remarkable mix of 1930s styles at Putney Heath
Postwar public housing at Innes Garden

location.address: Far end (western) of Portsmouth Road, Putney Heath, SW15 3TJ
location.meeting_point: Start far end of Portsmouth Road

name: Self-guided Modern Architecture Walk – Putney Heath
